availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Mason Marcus (Grant County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farmer. Son of John W. Marcus and Susan Marcus. Married to Mary Ann Penell Marcus in Scott County, Kentucky, on October 12, 1860. Father of Emeline Marcus, Martha Marcus, and Alice Marcus. Farmer in Grant County in 1860. Served in the 18th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from November 25, 1861, to June 22, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 831.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Cordova, p. 487A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Grant County Marriages, Film #000183225, p. 305 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
U.S. National Homes for Disabled Volunteer Soldiers, 1866-1938, Leavenworth, KS, "M" Register, p. 12129.
